Article Title: EC to begin tour of poll-bound states
Article Text:
BJP Accuses Mamata of Misleading Nation After SC SIR Ruling, TMC Counters Claims

EC will kick off its visits to poll-bound states to assess poll preparedness, with a tour of Assam from Feb 16 to 18, according to sources in the commission.Sources told TOI that CEC Gyanesh Kumar and ECs S S Sandhu and Vivek Joshi may visit Tamil Nadu and Puducherry in the last week of this month. The tour of Bengal and Kerala is likely to happen only in March; the dates are yet to be finalised.Assembly polls are due in the four states and UT of Puducherry in April-May. An announcement is possible in the second half of March.During their visits, EC will hold discussions with political party netas, chief secretary and DGP, district magistrates, and the brass of law enforcement agencies.
Article Summary: EC will kick off its visits to poll-bound states to assess poll preparedness, with a tour of Assam from Feb 16 to 18. The tour of Bengal and Kerala is likely to happen only in March; the dates are yet to be finalised. Assembly polls are due in the four states and UT of Puducherry in April-May.

Article Title: ‘Touched me repeatedly’: Bihar man held for molesting co-passenger on Hanoi flight
Article Text:
Kolkata: ₹100cr Pollution Fight, KMC Budget On Roads & Water, BMC Promises Better Services

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

KOLKATA: A male passenger, Abdur Rahim, was arrested at the Kolkata airport after a co-passenger alleged that he molested her during a flight from Hanoi, Vietnam.In the complaint, the woman, who was travelling in seat 26A, complained that the passenger in seat 26B repeated touched her inappropriately.She initially believed the contact was accidental but after it happened three-four times, she confluded it was intentional. She also alleged that Rahim, who hails from Bhagalpur in Bihar, made inappropriate comments.When she alerted the airline staff, the crew intervened and shifted the passenger to another seat. When the flight reached Kolkata, Rahim was handed him over to security personnel.CISF personnel detained the man and handed him over at the NSCBI Airport police station.Rahim was arrested and produced at Barasat court. He is facing charges related to molestation and verbal abuse, police added.
Article Summary: Male passenger, Abdur Rahim, was arrested at the Kolkata airport after a co- passenger alleged that he molested her during a flight from Hanoi, Vietnam. The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault.

Article Title: Jamaat wins in Bangla border areas spark worries
Article Text:
BNP Demands Sheikh Hasina's Extradition From India After Bangladesh Poll Win





Concerns have deepened after Friday’s Bangladesh poll results showed hardliner Jamaat-e-Islami and its allies winning many of their 68 seats in areas bordering India. The total tally is Jamaat’s highest in over 25 years.Jamaat’s historical and ideological proximity with Pakistan raises the risks for India, a peril flagged by BJP. The saffron party had bagged in 2021 more than 16 Bengal assembly constituencies that share borders with the areas of Bangladesh where Jamaat has made inroads. “Bangladesh is a different country. We expect the newly formed govt to maintain law and order and ensure minorities will not be persecuted. But Jamaat’s victory along the border is worrying. It clearly shows there has been strong radicalisation on both sides of the border,” Union minister Sukanta Majumdar of BJP said.South 24 Parganas, North 24 Parganas, Nadia, Murshidabad, Malda and Alipurduar are among the Bengal districts that share borders with Bangladesh zones where Jamaat has come up trumps. Broadly, Jamaat has put its footprint on much of western Bangladesh, including Satkhira, Mymensingh, Rajshahi, Rangpur and Gaibandha.Functionaries of exiled former PM Sheikh Hasina’s Awami League indicated that Jamaat, banned earlier, started spreading its influence over the past year. “Jamaat is a radical outfit which believes in hardlines which was never acceptable to democratic parties like Awami League. Unfortunately, they spread their organisation during the tenure of the interim govt,” said Salim Mahmud, former Awami League MP of Chandpur (1).In the 2001 election, Jamaat won 17 seats. In 2008, it was reduced to two. In 2013, Jamaat’s registration was cancelled by Bangladesh’s Supreme Court. While Hasina banned Jamaat, the interim govt lifted it in 2024.
Article Summary: Jamaat-e-Islami and its allies won many of their 68 seats in areas bordering India. The total tally is Jamaat’s highest in over 25 years. The saffron party had bagged in 2021 more than 16 Bengal assembly constituencies that share borders with the areas of Bangladesh.
